intro: Leuenbergeria portulacifolia, commonly known as the desert rose or false rose, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and showy, pink or red flowers that bloom in summer. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, making it well adapted to drought conditions. It has a compact growth habit and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance. Leuenbergeria portulacifolia is also valued for its ability to store water in its leaves, which helps it survive in harsh climates.
